view

Class EventDialog

  • java.lang.Object
    • javafx.scene.control.Dialog<javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.String,CalendarEvent>>
      • view.EventDialog
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    javafx.event.EventTarget

    public class EventDialog
extends javafx.scene.control.Dialog<javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.String,CalendarEvent>>
    a modal dialog which can produce new or edit existing CalendarEvent objects instantiation of/changes to CalendarEvents only happens when the dialog is invoked via the blocking Dialog.showAndWait() call. If the user closes the window by any means other than the OK button, no object is created and all changes are discarded.
    Author:
    Kitty Elliott

    • Constructor Detail

      • EventDialog

        private EventDialog(java.lang.Object seed,
                    java.lang.String selectedCalendar,
                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> possibleCalendars)
        Constructor. If given a CalendarEvent object, then that event will be loaded, and will be updated with the information the user inputs into this EventDialog if the user clicks OK. This can be determined if the return value of Dialog.showAndWait() is present.

        If given a temporal object, the initial date and start/end times will be derived from that Date, and Dialog.showAndWait() will optionally return a Pair with the name of the selected calendar as its key and the CalendarEvent as its value. If given null, then the current date and time will be used to set the initial values.

        Parameters:
        seed - either a CalendarEvent, LocalDate LocalDateTime, or null
        selectedCalendar - the name of a calendar which will be the initial selection. Must be a member of possibleCalendars, or else null, in which case the first name from the sorted members of possibleCalendars will be the initial calendar selection.
        possibleCalendars - a set of calendar names to choose from.
        See Also:
        getResult(ButtonType)

    • Method Detail

      • editEvent

        public static EventDialog editEvent(CalendarEvent event,
                                    java.lang.String selectedCalendar,
                                    java.util.Set<java.lang.String> possibleCalendars)
        Create a new instance of this class to edit the given event.
        Parameters:
        event - the event to be edited. must not be null.
        selectedCalendar - the name of the calendar the given event belongs to
        possibleCalendars - a set of calendar names that the event could belong to
        Returns:
        the EventDialog object which will edit the event when called via the blocking Dialog.showAndWait() method
        Throws:
        java.lang.IllegalArgumentException - if any argument is null, or selectedCalendar is not a member of possibleCalendars

      • newEvent

        public static EventDialog newEvent(java.util.Set<java.lang.String> possibleCalendars)
        create a new instance of this class to create a new CalendarEvent.
        Parameters:
        possibleCalendars - a set of calendar names which the event could be assigned to
        Returns:
        the EventDialog object which will return the new event when called via the blocking Dialog.showAndWait() method.

      • newEventAt

        public static EventDialog newEventAt(java.time.LocalDate dateTime,
                                     java.util.Set<java.lang.String> possibleCalendars)
        create a new instance of this class to create a new CalendarEvent.
        Parameters:
        dateTime - the date from which the initial date and time values of the EventDialog will be derived.
        possibleCalendars - a set of calendar names which the event could be assigned to
        Returns:
        the EventDialog object which will return the new event when called via the blocking Dialog.showAndWait() method.

      • newEventAt

        public static EventDialog newEventAt(java.time.LocalDateTime dateTime,
                                     java.util.Set<java.lang.String> possibleCalendars)
        create a new instance of this class to create a new CalendarEvent.
        Parameters:
        dateTime - the date and time from which the initial date and time values of the EventDialog will be derived.
        possibleCalendars - a set of calendar names which the event could be assigned to
        Returns:
        the EventDialog object which will return the new event when called via the blocking Dialog.showAndWait() method.

      • yearFormatter

        private static javafx.scene.control.TextFormatter.Change yearFormatter(javafx.scene.control.TextFormatter.Change chg)
        intercepts changes to the yearField TextField. If the change contains any non-digit characters, those are filtered out.
        Parameters:
        chg - represents the change
        Returns:
        the possibly altered

      • yearKeyHandler

        private void yearKeyHandler(javafx.scene.input.KeyEvent e)
        key event handler for yearField. Increments the year when up arrow is pressed. Decrements to a lower bound of zero if down arrow is pressed.
        Parameters:
        e - the key event

        put together the scene graph for this object's DialogPane

      • fillNonTimeElements

        private void fillNonTimeElements()
        set starting values for the contents of non-time-related graphical elements. If the CalendarEvent is not null, its title, location, and notes will be loaded.

        initialize values for time-related graphical elements

      • updateNumDaysInMonth

        private void updateNumDaysInMonth()
        called when the month or year fields are updated. updates the number of days available for selection in the monthSelector ChoiceBox.

      • nullIfBlank

        private java.lang.String nullIfBlank(java.lang.String s)
        maps empty or whitespace-only strings to null
        Parameters:
        s - any string
        Returns:
        the given string unchanged, or null if that string is empty or contains only whitespace

      • getResult

        private javafx.util.Pair<java.lang.String,CalendarEvent> getResult(javafx.scene.control.ButtonType bt)
        the "result converter" for this Dialog object. Returns an event if changes were committed. Used to produce the value returned by this.showAndWait()
        Parameters:
        bt - the type of button that this is in response to.
        Returns:
        a Pair whose key is the name of the calendar that the event was assigned to and whose value is the newly created or edited CalendarEvent object.
